headline: Thin-Crust Pizza Dough
description: This thin-crust pizza dough recipe is easy to make with just five ingredients for a no-rise dough that bakes up crisp, chewy, and delicious.

video.name: How to Make Thin Crust Pizza Dough

name: Thin-Crust Pizza Dough

recipeInstructions.text: Dissolve yeast and sugar in warm water that's 110 degrees F (44 degrees C) in a small bowl. Let stand until yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam, about 5 to 8 minutes.
Combine 1 3/4 cups flour and salt in a large bowl. Pour in yeast mixture; mix well until dough comes together.
Transfer dough to a floured surface and knead until smooth, about 2 minutes. Add remaining 1/4 cup flour if dough is too sticky.
Roll dough into a 12-inch circle. Transfer to a greased pizza pan.

review.reviewBody: Easy and fast! We kneaded in the bowl and let dough ball rest 10-20 minutes covered before rolling it out. Parbake 90 seconds on stone, pull off and add toppings, then bake another 5-6 minutes. Crispy and chewy!
This is a great simple recipe for crunchy crust pizza!
We added oregano to the dough, and molasses. It was very easy to work, and makes a delicious pie. Used a cast iron skillet for baking.

Great basic recipe! Tastes great as is, but it's also a great base to add flavor: bit of honey or sugar, herbs or spices. A slather of butter across the cooked edge. I love this because there's no rise/waiting time. Makes for a fast dinner. I make big batches and freeze it. Defrost in fridge, then use whenever!

I am so glad I found this pizza dough recipe, I made the other day and loved it what I made was a sausage & spinach garlic calzone delicious and nice brown bottom rust. I gave some to a friend my neighbor her and her husband loved it so much that they wanted the recipe I was so glad to pass it on. Thank you again for another great recipe allrecipes.com is always my go to when I make a dish.
Easy and simple recipe for a tasty thin crust pizza.

40 min pizza. Simple and delicious. I didn't have a roller with me so I used my hands resulting in a smaller, thicker crust with 8 slices. Needed 12 minutes in the oven due to its thickness, but turned out tasty. Kind of like Domino's New York Crust. I didn't prebake my dough. Simply added topping to the raw dough and popped it into the oven. The bottom of the crust still looked amazing.
The crust was not crispy enough, and I even baked it for 5 minutes prior to adding the toppings. Thought it tasted like cardboard

This is my go to recipe. I use 1 cup all purpose and 1 cup of wheat flour. I use pasta sauce I get at Aldi as the pizza sauce. I bake on a pizza stone. Crunchy and chewy. Thank you so much for the recipe.

Turned out great . We had our own tomatoes & sauce and spinach. Had some mozzarella & provolone. Hubby ate his prosciutto but we had some ham & deli meat. Of all nights not to have other veggies! I did take a pic.
Was great and easy!! Used in my Ooni Pizza oven. Crispy! Edit: do not Roll it- press out dough with finger tips. Even better!
I had been testing a pizza oven and we made dough before, we also tried buying ready made dough but this was the best recipe I had tried so far if you are aiming for a thin crust pizza .

I loved this recipe. For some reason my dough was very wet and I had to add another cup or so of flour, maybe I messed the ratio up however the crust was perfect with our pizza tonight. Garlic, cilantro, basil and dill from the garden ground in the molcajete. Large slices of pepperoni, fresh sliced tomatoes, and kalamata olives. Seriously perfect. Also! I substituted some mexican corn flour, it was good.
I too added a bit more sugar into the recipe. Other than that I made no changes and it was delicious.

Only made one change, I brushed the dough with garlic oil instead of olive oil. This is the easiest and fastest dough recipe I've found. Rolled it out into a 9x15 pan; perfect size pizza for two. Make sure you bake the crust the full 5 minutes before topping.
I baked mine for 15 minutes on 450F cause our convection oven didn't have 500F. Turned out lovely. Medium crisp crust and the dough is soft.

I used this base for a Vegan flatbread, it was so easy to make, really did take less than 20 minutes overall, and it’s delicious and crispy! In the past when making pizza from scratch, i always found the base was soggy (i don’t have any fancy pizza tray) so I put the pizza base in with some olive oil on a baking tray at 500 degrees for about 4 minutes before adding the toppings, then bake for another 6-8 minutes directly on the oven rack.

I make this all the time! This turns out perfectly each time too! I make a lot of dough, usually enough for 22 pizzas for our camping group's pizza night. I par-bake them for about 3 min and then let them cool. We top them and then cook them in our egg on a pizza stone (450F). I have also just par-baked them and froze them after cooling. Makes it easy to make pizza in a pinch!

I am making this recipe and I do have to say, it's an easy dough to make but the crust was NOT thin. It was fat, even though I rolled it out thin. Also, the oven temp will vary with the oven you have. 500 degrees was too much for my oven and I did it at 400. So., next time, I'm halving the dough and I added garlic powder per some commentors.

Delightful! I have tried quite a few pizza dough recipes and haven't liked any.....until now! This dough was crispy on the outside and soft on the inside, it reminded me so much of the pizza hut crust. The flavor isn't as good as Pizza Hut but it's pretty darn good. I will continue to try new pizza dough recipes because I feel there has to be a better one out there but I will make this one along with the new recipe in case the new one tanks, at least I'll have this one to fall back on. I think I'll try baking this dough with some garlic, butter, and cheese. Definitely worth a try if you want a decent-tasting dough with a nice crispy crust.
My husband and I love this recipe. Quick and tasty!!! To make it crispy, we make it really thin and pour melted butter or olive oil (or both) under the pizza.

Worked great! I added oregano and garlic like another poster suggested. I'd like to know if anyone has frozen this? Did you do it in a ball or roll it out first? If you rolled it did you thaw it before topping and cooking? Has anyone used this dough to prep a whole pizza then freeze the pizzas? If so did you straight bake or thaw first? Next time we make this im going to brush with garlic butter before topping.

This is by far my family's favorite pizza crust. The first time I made it I felt it was still too thick So the second time I made two pizza crusts from this recipe and it turned out wonderful! I cooked it for a few mins then spread a little olive oil then added fresh sliced mozzarella and crushed tomato. Sprinkled a little pizza seasoning then topped with fresh basil. Fantastic!
It came out great but I do suggest letting the dough rise for at least 30 mins for an easier time shaping for the pizza
Made exactly as written! Easy and delicious!

A good, solid base. Not perfect, but can be fine tuned to your liking. I’ve made this twice now, and it turned out well both times. I baked it at 450 the first time and 425 the second, and both worked fine. 500 is definitely overkill. I also recommend pre-baking your crust with just spices and a thin coat of olive oil for about 5 minutes before adding your toppings, if you want it a little crispier.
I cut the sugar to 2 Tbl based on others comments. I thought this was a very good recipe.
Great! Made as is + added a 1 tsp. garlic powder. Baked it for 1 min before topping it and then added toppings and baked about 5-6 min. more! Delicious!
I made it exactly as is. Came out perfect!

I have made this pizza crust many, many times and it is always good. I have made a few additions to fit my and my husband's taste by adding 1/2 tsp of oregano, basil, sage, thyme, onion powder. I also chopped 3 cloves of garlic and added that as well. The result was a very flavorful crust that we both enjoyed.

Excellent! I did use 1/2 tsp sugar instead of 1/4 and 3/4 tsp rapid dry yeast because I didn’t have active dry and then added Italian seasonings to the dough. Rolled and then tossed until it was stretched nicely and put it on my preheated pizza stone and baked two minutes before adding sauce and the toppings. Super crunchy! It was perfect! Great recipe!!!
A very good recipe for pizza dough. I made it, turned out very well.

This worked great. I did up the salt to a teaspoon, and added thyme and sage to the dough. Also baked at 450 for a bit longer time so it would crisp better. Found that 500 at 10 minutes just barely had the crust not doughy, and I like it a bit crisper than that, and the veggies a bit softer. This was actually the first recipe I’ve ever made pizza with, so thanks!
Have made several times. Nice quick recipe. Dough hook beats it up nicely. Smooth texture. DaleM
So easy and delicious!!! crispy and perfect!! I made margherita pizza in my bbq on a pizza stone for friends. Everyone raved about the base!
I added a bit more sugar than recommended. My whole family ate and LOVED it. Thank you so much for teaching me.
It's thin and flaky. good recipe.
This crust is fantastic! like others have mentioned, I increased the salt to 1 tsp. This crust is easy and quick to make.I have it once a week. Thanks !

Super easy dough, feel free to throw in spices in the dry mix that you prefer. Going to be our make it your own Mondays pizza night, thank you for sharing your recipe!

I really utilized my KitchenAid to knead the Dough slowly for 3 minutes...add flour as needed so it is easier to handle. Pizza stones preheated in the oven, a little bit of corn meal on the slides/stones, top it the way you like bake at 500 for 8 minutes. Rotate if desired for an even bake. Make sure you roll out your dough nice and thin. Perfection.
This does make a very crispy crust! We also par-baked before adding toppings to make it extra crispy. Will definitely use this recipe again.
It looked good but the flavor was lacking. Still looking!

Since Covid19 and lockdown became the norm in Ontario and unable to dine in our favourite Italian restaurant had to look for alternatives and came across the best Thin-Crust Pizza Dough there is... of course i had tried other recipes and had to go back to this over and over... Minor tweaks i increased the salt to 1 tsp, added 1/4 tsp honey and to achieve thin crust i split the dough into 2 and let it sit for few hours to have a risen dough that is perfect to our liking.

This is my go to pizza dough recipe. I like a little more fluff so I’ll often go with the packet (2-1/4 tsp) yeast but I go as is more often than not. I’ve also used honey instead of sugar with the yeast and half wheat flour to mix things up. Depending on my toppings I may add powdered garlic and oregano to the flour.
I add 2 TBS of olive oil to the wet mix after the yeast had proofed. Used my fingers to press it into two 10" iron skillets. Turned out great!
This recipe isn't to make thin crust pizza dough. It's basically instructions on how to make a normal pizza dough and then mash it out into a dense, thin crust instead of a proper thin crust.

I just love this recipe for thin pizza crust! After reading some of the reviews I did add some garlic powder & 1 tbls. of honey to the dough mixture. I didn't add all of the flour leaving out 3/4 c. which I used to knead the dough with. Also I did let the dough rise in a warmed oven for about 2 hours. As one reviewer recommended before putting the dough in the oven put a cast iron pan on the dough (used parchment paper in-between) and bake in a 450 degree oven for 5 minutes. Take the pies out of the oven , remove the cast iron pan then add your toppings. Bake another 20 minutes at 450 degrees. This made two 12" pies.

Best Pizza Dough ever! Highly recommend it! 
I added oregano to dough before resting.
Simple & one of the best we have tried. It’s a winner.
Good, made a 14 inch with the dough. I would add more sugar
I made it as the recipe said. It was chewy and flavorless. I won’t make it again.

This is a great recipe. Made it at least 8 times. 
I adjusted a bit. Added 1/2 tsp of garlic powder. I also divide into 2 equal amounts. I also do not have a stone so I bake dough at 450 deg. on sheetpan 8 minutes till crispy. 
Then add pizza sauce and tons of cheese, pepperoni, onions and mushrooms. Bake another 10 mins.
So easy to make and so good! We like it better than crust from most of the pizza places nearby.
Great crust, I’ll be making it again for sure.
Finally. I have found my go to pizza crust. Possibilities on seasoning are endless.
Most perfect and crunchy pizza dough ever. I prepared half of it and it was good for a 22 cm mold.

This is my new favorite pizza dough. I make it in my bread machine, double the recipe, use fast acting yeast and let the machine run. The make the pizza, I take a 10” cast iron skillet, put in on my gas stove on medium high & place the dough I.
This has become our go-to pizza crust! I sometimes add a little garlic and oregano to give it a little extra something. Love it.
Superb recipe. My husband was blown away by how quickly I made pizza. Very very yummy.

Well, I don’t know what I did wrong, but the dough didn’t turn out crusty at all. Stuck to the pizza stone so we essentially just ate the toppings without dough. I followed instructions and put the crust in on a pre-heated pizza stone for 1 min before adding toppings and tried to cook for 8 mins. per recipe. Took out, the dough was soft & stuck to stone. Reheated at 500 for another 5-8 mins and covered toppings with foil to prevent burning the top. When I removed from the oven 2nd time, the dough still stuck & was almost impossible to pull off stone. Very disappointing.
Followed recipe and it was so good!!!!

I made it exactly as it said. It was tough and not thin or very crispy. I did prebake the crust so it wouldn't be soggy but the crust wasn't tasty. It was hard to cut. I won't make it again without significant changes.

I made a double batch and was able to make 4 smaller pizzas on cookie sheets. My family loved it.
The dough was very simple to make. I made mine in the morning, put it in the frig & used later for dinner. The dough did rise while in the frig . I added some fresh chopped rosemary, garlic salt & a small amount of olive oil to the dough before forming the crusts.
I put cornmeal on the pan before adding the crust. Then baked the crusts in 500 degree ovens for 10 minutes. 
Removed the crusts from the ovens and added our toppings. Popped them back into the ovens for another 10-12 minutes. Great thin crust pizzas!
This recipe will probably be used weekly.
This was a great recipe for a quick non rise dough. Came out great in a pinch, will def make again. Thanks for the post

I needed quick easy crust for cooking up pizzas for boat crew underway. This is a keeper. I tripled the recipe. Got 3 14” pizzas and 4 10” pizzas. Crust comes together quick, about 30mins for me with kneading. And 12-14 minutes to cook since 450 was my highest temp. Everyone (8 crew) loved it.
Super easy recipe. Done in no time. Crust was nice and crunchy. Took a little longer to cook in the oven, about 12 minutes.
Split the dough to make 2 thin crusts and added 1Tbsp of honey. Really good crust.
I enjoyed this recipe for my camp chef artisan oven. keep it thin and crispy with A little fluff inside.
followed everything and it turned out great. everyone in the house loved it.
My favorite after trying many others. Gets a crispy crust and still a bit of softer dough in middle. Everyone I make it for RAVES about it. I do let it rest and rise fir a couple hours.

It was good n I’ll try it again. Mine crust turned out a little tough but over all a good recipe n I’ll try it again! one suggestion... bake the crust at 350 for 10 minutes before putting topping on then when toppings are on bake at 350 for 30 minutes!
Great pizza dough

Not crispy or all that thin. Reminded me of pizza doughs you buy at the grocery store pre- cooked. I doubled the recipe for 2 pizzas and the 2nd put in the oven at 575 (our usual temp for pizza) and it was better.
Outstanding recipe! Makes the perfect crust and super easy to make!

I had to try this a few times with a few tweaks to hit the sweet spot. First, I love that I don't have to haul out the stand mixer for a "right now" dough. Second, I used a full teaspoon of sugar, salt, and garlic. Third, I brushed the dough with olive oil and par-baked it for a couple minutes. Finally, i added my sauce, cheese and toppings, and baked for about 8 minutes.
The dough was very quick and easy to make. It tasted great as well .

What a find !! Not only does the crust turn out perfect , it takes no time at all , I whipped up a scrumptious pizza in less then 20 mins .. my son who’s a finicky chef as well as a finicky eater couldn’t believe it , and the pizza was gone in a matter of minutes.. I did divide the dough into 2 ,12inch pans and it was on point .. this little gem of a recipe is a keeper
I definitely had to double this, and it made 5 little 9 inch pizzas

I made this pizza dough mainly because I had a lot of old yeast in the house, and I wanted to proof it. I put most of the dead yeast in the compost, but I found a strip - no expiration date - but the packet I proofed actually produced a foamy cap. I mixed it with the flour and salt. It was very easy to knead on a flouted surface and rolled out pretty well. I had to keep pushing and pulling to make it stretch to the round metal pizza baking pan I own but have seldom used. The dough stretched and filled pan without ripping. I put some spaghetti sauce on top with scrambled hamburger and onion, thinly sliced zucchini, sliced mushrooms, and shredded cheese. It was surprisingly delicious.

So, if you make this and bake it immediately... It will be okay. Hence the 3 stars. TO MAKE IT BETTER: At a minimum, let is rise for an hour, punch it down, then let it rise another hour. If you have the foresight to make it a day ahead and rise in the fridge for 24 hours, then even better. Get it out 2 hours before baking. 

Also, shape with your hands instead of a rolling pin. I press it out on my counter a bit into a thick disc, then spray both sides with a little oil. Now you can press it out into the thin shape you are looking for. Try to leave a little edge as a crust. Not much, but it helps.

Excellent! I divided and made two very thin pies on two different days. Cooked ay 475 for 12-13 minutes. I’m not sure my over even goes to 500! This tastes like my favorite thin crust at a local pizza place!
The pizza dough was delicious.
I used half whole wheat flour. Split the dough into 2 crusts. I lightly crisped the rolled out dough on a cast iron griddle before topping. I like crisp dough. I got two 12 inch pizzas.
This recipe came out great. I made a Chicago deep dish pizza with it & a calzone. It was perfect for what I needed

I've made this dough several times, and it's very good, but I found that the dough had more flavor the next day of leftovers. I made this again last night but I mixed the dough in the afternoon and refrigerated it for 3 hours to allow it to develop some flavor. Didn't change a thing in the recipe. It was extra tasty and rolled out super thin after it warmed up. Mid point of baking I brushed garlic butter on the exposed edges. Over the top fabulous. Thanks for the recipe.
i have made this recipe many times i usually add more water (1cup). Made it last night and m family told me i killed it!!
Delicious. I doubled the recipe and stretched them onto 2 14 inch pans and baked for 8 minutes at 500 degrees. Yum! Perfect texture.

This is a great crust! I let it cook closer to 20mins on 500. I like my thin crust crispy and I have an older stove. I added chopped bell peppers (squeezes the water out as much as possible in paper towels, tomato, chopped spinach and some left over bacon from breakfast yesterday. So good, even in a rectangle!
This was an easy and Satisfying recipe
Thin, crisp, and quick. It was everything I wanted. I
Best pizza crust recipe I have ever tried, nice and crispy.. I used coconut oil to grease my pan.
Texture was great. Just needs more flavor... Maybe more salt. I doubled the recipe for 2 pizzas and used 1/3 cup olive oil.
Loved it. Added 1/4tsp paprika and 1/2 tsp garlic powder to flavor the dough before adding the water. I would recommend a pizza stone if you have one.
This turned out very chewy. Does any have any suggestions for why that may have happened?
Delish! Par-cooked for 10 minutes then added toppings and baked another 20. I froze one of the par cooked crust for a quick meal later in the week. They freeze very well.
Didn't have too! This is the best white sauce I've found! My grant kids love it! So does my wife.
Best pizza dough ever! Added Italian seasoning, garlic and onion powder. I’ll be making more this weekend, it was so good. Thanks for this easy and delicious recipe.
Followed recipe to a tee! Was perfect and crunchy. No oil is great ... can add more on top!!!
I also split this recipe and made 2 super thin pies out of it.

This was delicious! Based on other reviews, I used a tsp of salt instead of half, rolled it thin, and baked the crust on a hot pan for a minute before baking with the added toppings. Best thin crust we’ve ever had.
